com.rolemodelsoft.drawlet.util
Class ValueAdapter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.rolemodelsoft.drawlet.util.ValueAdapter
public class ValueAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer

This is a quick and dirty version of the Adapter pattern which observes some model for changes in some aspect, and updates a target with a one argument message based on the new value of that aspect. There are a lot of other and more flexible ways to accomplish similar goals. This was an attempt to get a minimal version up and prove the concept.

Constructor Detail

ValueAdapter

public ValueAdapter(Observable model,
                    java.lang.String aspect,
                    java.lang.Object target,
                    java.lang.String affect)
Answer an instance that affects its target whenever the identified aspect of the identified model changes.
Parameters:
model - the subject being watched.
aspect - the aspect of the subject of interest... tied to a getter message.
target - the object who will be affected when the aspect changes.
affect - the message sent to the target when the aspect changes, with the value of the aspect as its argument.

protected java.lang.reflect.Method getMessage(java.lang.Class targetClass,
                                              java.lang.String message,
                                              java.lang.Class[] targetParameterClasses)
Provides the method corresponding to the parameters or null if one can't be found.
Parameters:

message - the name of the method we'd like to find.
targetParameterClasses - the classes of the arguments of the method we'd like to find.

Parameters:

Send the one argument message to the target with the value as the argument.
Throws:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If we just can't find a method that seems to fit the criteria.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If access is not permitted to the method (needs to be public?).

Get the value of interest from the subject.
